Software Engineer

https://segment.com April 2016 - April 2017 // 1 yr 1 mo (SF)

Deep understanding of customer data collection, analytics, and actually implementing them.

Worked with many clients and their data infrastructure — some great, some terrible.

Comprehensive understanding of best practices when it comes to collecting web, mobile, or server side data to understand the 360 view of the customer

Maintained a catalog of 150-200 integrations such as Google Analytics, Intercom, Mixpanel, and other enterprise software by shipping bug fixes and improvements

Built enterprise integrations to help collect and send customer data to complex softwares such as Responsys, Facebook Offline Conversions, Adobe Analytics, Nielsen DCR, etc.

Often involved during POCs due to my prior customer facing experience + focus for customer impact + technical acumen. Helped close deals worth $$$

Success Engineer

https://segment.com April 2015 - April 2016 // 1 yr 1 mo (SF)

Helped define and raise the bar of expected productivity for this role

By the time I left, I had closed 5k-6k Zendesk tickets (still holds record for most all time by a Success Engineer) which consisted of understanding customer implementations, debugging, problem solving, and ensuring that customers are successful.

Wrote tons of technical documentation as well as implementation guides.

During this time, Segment did not have a dedicated engineering team for all their integrations. Despite not being part of my role, I managed the backlog of bugs by shipping fixes on my own time. This eventually led to my promotion into engineering, product, and design in just one year.

Web Development Team Lead / Product Manager

Glasshopper Jan 2015 (SF)

Led a development team of four where they built a public API and a mobile application that make bar crawling more social, enjoyable, and memorable.

The MVP of the project was completed in less than 3 weeks and demoed in front of over +100 people.

Learned an entirely new stack of langauges and technologies within those 3 weeks. These included MongoDB, Mongoose, Express, AngularJS, NodeJS, and Ionic framework.
